org.trianacode.taskgraph.service

Interface RunnableInstance

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRunnableTask, AbstractServiceTask, NonRunnableTask, RunnableTask

    public interface RunnableInstance
    Communication interface between data monitors and runnable instances. The monitor sends a finished notification when it has finished outputting its data, allowing the runnable instance to continue with its execution (assuming sends are blocking). When data is received by the monitor the runnable instance is sent a wake-up call to allow it to start processing.
    See Also:
    LocalCable, Monitor

    • Method Detail

      • addExecutionListener

        void addExecutionListener(ExecutionListener listener)
        Adds a execution state listener to this runnable instance

      • removeExecutionListener

        void removeExecutionListener(ExecutionListener listener)
        Removes a execution state listener from this runnable instance

      • getExecutionState

        ExecutionState getExecutionState()
        Returns:
        the current state of te runnable instance (e.g. runnable task)

      • wakeUp

        void wakeUp()
        Indicates to the runnable instance that a wake-up signal has been received from the scheduler. It is up to a task to respond to this wake-up, or to ignore it if wake-ups have not been received from all the nodes a task requires to execute.

      • wakeUp

        void wakeUp(Node node)
        Indicates to the runnable instance that a wake-up signal has been received from the specified node (e.g. data is available on that node). A runnable instance should only run when it has received wake-ups from all the nodes it requires to execute.

      • pause

        void pause()
        Request a runnable instance to pause

      • resume

        void resume()
        Request a runnable instance to resume (unpause)

      • reset

        void reset()
        Order a runnable instance to stop and reset it to its pre-run state

      • finished

        void finished()
        Tell the data monitor that this thread monitor has completed outputting the data i.e. the data has been received by the receiving process.
